title: Australian man arrested in Bali after police allegedly find meth in his wallet
text:
An Australian man who served time in a Bali jail eight years ago for drug possession has been arrested on the island on suspicion of committing the same offence.

Ricky Shane Rawson, 57, was arrested on Friday after police raided his Kuta hotel room and allegedly found 0.38 grams of ice in his wallet.

An investigation is now underway to determine if Rawson was using the drug for himself or was dealing it to others.

Australian man Ricky Shane Rawson, 57, (pictured) who served time in a Bali jail eight years ago for drug possession has been arrested on the island on suspicion of committing the same offence

Rawson allegedly told police he was using the drugs as medication to treat a chest problem, Channel 7 reported.

'We also got a glass pipe with meth in it,' a Bali police spokesman told The Herald Sun.

'The suspect bought meth from someone with the initials RZ for IDR700,000 ($65).'

The Australian had been due to finish his holiday on Saturday.

Rawson was sentenced to four months behind bars in 2011 after being arrested with 0.06 grams of methamphetamine.

He was released in September of that year after serving his sentence at the country's Kerobokan jail.

Ricky Shane Rawson, 57, was arrested on Friday after police raided his Kuta hotel room and allegedly found 0.38 grams of ice in his wallet

Rawson (pictured) was sentenced to four months behind bars in 2011 after being arrested with 0.06 grams of methamphetamine

The 57-year-old faced a maximum 12-year prison sentence, but he received a more lenient punishment because lawyers argued he used drugs to combat depression.

It comes as Gold Coast carpenter Matthew Woods was given a four-month sentence for snatching a tourist's bag and then making off on a motorbike.

He faced seven years behind bars but a judge said she believed Woods was repentant and unlikely to offend again.
description: Ricky Shane Rawson, 57, was arrested on Friday after police allegedly found 0.38 grams of ice in his wallet. He was sentenced to four months in prison in 2011 after being found with 0.06 grams of the drug.
